publication.title: Enhancing energy efficiency of database applications using SSDs
publication.jconf: Canadian Conference on Computer Science & Software Engineering
publication.keyword: Energy Consumption;Energy Efficient;Energy Use;Rule of Thumb;Spectrum;
publication.abstract: Presently, solid state disks (SSDs) are emerging as a disruptive storage technology and promise breakthroughs for important application properties. They quickly enter the enterprise domain and (partially) replace magnetic disks (HDDs) for database servers. To identify performance and energy use of both types of storage devices, we have built an analysis tool and measured access times and energy needed for

publication.title: Performance and Power Evaluation of Flash-Aware Buffer Algorithms
publication.abstract: With ash disks being an important alternative to conven- tional magnetic disks, various design aspects of DBMSs, whose I/O behavior is performance-critical, and especially their I/O architecture should be reconsidered.
